trans-unit.source: Backup operation exports a key from Azure Key Vault in a protected form.
trans-unit.target: Backup operation exports a key from Azure Key Vault in a protected form.

trans-unit.source: Note that this operation does NOT return key material in a form that can be used outside the Azure Key Vault system, the returned key material is either protected to a Azure Key Vault HSM or to Azure Key Vault itself.
trans-unit.target: Note that this operation does NOT return key material in a form that can be used outside the Azure Key Vault system, the returned key material is either protected to a Azure Key Vault HSM or to Azure Key Vault itself.

trans-unit.source: The intent of this operation is to allow a client to GENERATE a key in one Azure Key Vault instance, BACKUP the key, and then RESTORE it into another Azure Key Vault instance.
trans-unit.target: The intent of this operation is to allow a client to GENERATE a key in one Azure Key Vault instance, BACKUP the key, and then RESTORE it into another Azure Key Vault instance.

trans-unit.source: The BACKUP operation may be used to export, in protected form, any key type from Azure Key Vault.
trans-unit.target: The BACKUP operation may be used to export, in protected form, any key type from Azure Key Vault.

trans-unit.source: Individual versions of a key cannot be backed up.
trans-unit.target: Individual versions of a key cannot be backed up.

trans-unit.source: BACKUP / RESTORE can be performed within geographical boundaries only; meaning that a BACKUP from one geographical area cannot be restored to another geographical area.
trans-unit.target: BACKUP / RESTORE can be performed within geographical boundaries only; meaning that a BACKUP from one geographical area cannot be restored to another geographical area.

trans-unit.source: For example, a backup from the US geographical area cannot be restored in an EU geographical area.
trans-unit.target: For example, a backup from the US geographical area cannot be restored in an EU geographical area.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the key to backup with {key-name} in the request URL.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the key to backup with {key-name} in the request URL.

trans-unit.source: Remarks: In the response, the backup attribute is an opaque value that contains the protected key.
trans-unit.target: Remarks: In the response, the backup attribute is an opaque value that contains the protected key.

trans-unit.source: The backup-value is an opaque value that contains the protected key and all key versions as Base64URL encoded octets.
trans-unit.target: The backup-value is an opaque value that contains the protected key and all key versions as Base64URL encoded octets.
